content:
To effectively manage and maintain the Rangers' fleet of individual grav-bikes, several support personnel roles are necessary for smooth operations, maintenance, and overall support. Some of these roles include:

1. Grav-bike Mechanic: Responsible for the maintenance, repair, and troubleshooting of the grav-bikes, ensuring their optimal performance and safety for the Rangers.
2. Parts and Inventory Specialist: Manages the inventory of spare parts, tools, and equipment needed for the maintenance and repair of the grav-bikes, ensuring that required resources are available when needed.
3. Grav-bike Operations Coordinator: Oversees the scheduling and coordination of grav-bike usage, maintenance, and training, ensuring that Rangers have access to operational grav-bikes as needed for their missions.
4. Grav-bike Training Instructor: Develops and delivers training programs for the Rangers on the proper operation, maintenance, and safety procedures for using the grav-bikes in various mission scenarios.
5. Battery Maintenance Technician: Handles the charging, storage, and maintenance of grav-bike batteries, ensuring a constant supply of energy for the fleet.
6. Communications and Electronics Technician: Maintains and repairs the advanced communication systems and other electronic components installed on the grav-bikes.
7. Grav-bike Customization and Configuration Specialist: Works with individual Rangers to customize and configure their grav-bikes to meet specific mission requirements and personal preferences, ensuring that each grav-bike is tailored to its user's needs.

These support personnel, along with other necessary roles, will help ensure the successful operation and maintenance of the Rangers' fleet of grav-bikes in support of the Kodian Frontier Service missions.
